getDescription().Description: Returns a description of the view action. The description should not be overly long and should fit nicely in a sentence like: "performing %description% action on view with id ..."

Parameters: String: String To be typed by @B_android#support#test#espresso#action#TypeTextAction_E@
TypeTextAction(java.lang.String).Description: Constructs @B_android#support#test#espresso#action#TypeTextAction_E@ with given string. If the string is empty it results in no-op (nothing is typed). By default this action sends a tap event to the center of the view to attain focus before typing.

Returns: a Matcher that will be tested prior to calling perform.
getConstraints().Description: A mechanism for ViewActions to specify what type of views they can operate on. A ViewAction can demand that the view passed to perform meets certain constraints. For example it may want to ensure the view is already in the viewable physical screen of the device or is of a certain type.

Parameters: String: String To be typed by @B_android#support#test#espresso#action#TypeTextAction_E@
boolean: indicates whether a tap should be sent to the underlying view before typing.
TypeTextAction(java.lang.String, boolean.Description: Constructs @B_android#support#test#espresso#action#TypeTextAction_E@ with given string. If the string is empty it results in no-op (nothing is typed).
